TopicTitle: Solar Panels Resetting Position on Quickload

Articles.Content:
Hello, I don't have much time when posting this, and can elaborate further tomorrow, but just throwing it out there now to see if this is possibly a common issue with a known solution.

While putting a probe into a polar orbit of Gael (GPP), I made a quicksave. For Kraken reasons (Ship ripped itself apart upon exiting timewarp) I reloaded the quicksave. Upon reloading the quicksave, as soon as the physics kicked in my whole ship appeared to experience some sort of physical jolt and then all of a sudden the 4 OX-STAT Photovoltaic Panels on  the probe seemed to reset their rotations to 0 degrees.

So as I don't have much time to play KSP lately I didn't want to have to re-do the mission, so I put a new probe on the launch pad and made a named quicksave, went into the SFS file and copied the position of the solar panels, and then inserted that into the regular quicksave and reloaded. Upon initially seeing the probe the solar panels are in the correct location, however once again it appears the moment physics load the same jolt happens and the panels are in the wrong rotation again.

Anyone ever experienced this before? If so is there some known thing that's causing this?

EDIT: So apparently all of my problems, ships ripping themselves apart upon exiting timewarp, as well as part resetting their direction and such ... Was all resolved by simply making sure that SAS was off when I quicksave and timewarp.. I'm imagining this is a bug spawned by one of my 131 mods. Which one I'll probably never know as long as I have this workaround.

EDIT: Come to think of it I just recently installed the S.A.V.E mod for backing up my game and had never had this issue prior to installation of that mod.. Going to try removing it and see if the issue happens again. Will report back results after adequate test play.

Edited March 11, 2019 by CoriW
